1194708961158713345.text: The past 50 years of fighting poverty through government-led programs has been largely ineffective, so let’s make sure the next 50 are powered by efforts that will work. I’ll save you the tweets, but do take a moment and read my full thoughts here: https://t.co/1RPQQmtP5R

1194708959577460742.text: Instead of trying to take down Opportunity Zones because of their distaste for @realDonaldTrump and our successful #taxreform package, I invite Democrats to come to the table and work together on a path forward.

1194708958684037122.text: I stand ready to improve the #OpportunityZones initiative in a positive way with anyone who wants to work together. None of this backroom dealing is helpful for people, who like me, grew up in single-parent households mired in poverty.

1194708957216026625.text: This is absolutely egregious, as we should be looking for ways to help improve the health of folks living in #OpportunityZones, where the average life expectancy is 3 years shorter than the natl average and the avg obesity rate is significantly higher than the national average.

1194708955878088704.text: In fact, @WhipClyburn & @RonWyden's will classify 'health centers' as a sin business and exclude them from the initiative. So there's a good chance our community centers and YMCAs are gone. Our after-school programs? Yup, they're gone too. All of our children's safe havens; gone.

1194708954804346880.text: Let me be even more clear. This is a state-driven initiative. 96% of zones show NO sign of gentrification. The other 4%? Go ask their governors—most of which are led by Democrats, like @RonWyden's. @WhipClyburn and Wyden seem to ignore this fact. Why? Well, it's pretty obvious.

1194708953806114818.text:
.@WhipClyburn & @RonWyden's bill would END:
✔️ Multiple OZ with a child poverty rate >30%
✔️ Multiple OZ with poverty rates >25% (double their statewide avg)
✔️ At least 1 zone with a senior poverty rate >40%
✔️ An OZ where African-Americans are 20% of the community

1194708952702996486.text:
Some facts about #OpportunityZones for y'all: 
✔️ An estimated $63 billion can already be expected to be invested into them

It's easy to lay out numbers, but these are people's LIVES that we're talking about.
